title: tRavis: Extra examples
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(as.factor(cyl), mpg)) +    geom_boxplot() +    tr_theme(base_family = "Helvetica", base_size = 20)

title: tRavis
text: Clean annotation files (CSV TSV) Pseudomonas aeruginosa pseudomonas.com. add extra columns, fill empty names corresponding locus tag.
code: link <- paste0(   "https://pseudomonas.com/downloads/pseudomonas/pgd_r_22_1/",   "Pseudomonas_aeruginosa_PAO1_107/Pseudomonas_aeruginosa_PAO1_107.csv.gz" )  tr_anno_cleaner(link) #> # A tibble: 5,713 × 3 #>    locus_tag gene_name product_name                                   #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                                          #>  1 PA0001    dnaA      chromosomal replication initiator protein DnaA #>  2 PA0002    dnaN      DNA polymerase III, beta chain                 #>  3 PA0003    recF      RecF protein                                   #>  4 PA0004    gyrB      DNA gyrase subunit B                           #>  5 PA0005    lptA      lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase, LptA    #>  6 PA0006    NA        conserved hypothetical protein                 #>  7 PA0007    NA        hypothetical protein                           #>  8 PA0008    glyS      glycyl-tRNA synthetase beta chain              #>  9 PA0009    glyQ      glycyl-tRNA synthetase alpha chain             #> 10 PA0010    tag       DNA-3-methyladenine glycosidase I              #> # ℹ 5,703 more rows tr_anno_cleaner(link, extra_cols = TRUE, fill_names = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 5,713 × 6 #>    locus_tag gene_name product_name                           start   end strand #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                                  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #>  1 PA0001    dnaA      chromosomal replication initiator pro…   483  2027 +      #>  2 PA0002    dnaN      DNA polymerase III, beta chain          2056  3159 +      #>  3 PA0003    recF      RecF protein                            3169  4278 +      #>  4 PA0004    gyrB      DNA gyrase subunit B                    4275  6695 +      #>  5 PA0005    lptA      lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase…  7018  7791 -      #>  6 PA0006    PA0006    conserved hypothetical protein          7803  8339 -      #>  7 PA0007    PA0007    hypothetical protein                    8671 10377 +      #>  8 PA0008    glyS      glycyl-tRNA synthetase beta chain      10434 12488 -      #>  9 PA0009    glyQ      glycyl-tRNA synthetase alpha chain     12488 13435 -      #> 10 PA0010    tag       DNA-3-methyladenine glycosidase I      13540 14091 +      #> # ℹ 5,703 more rows

title: tRavis
text: Takes DESeq2 results object, returns significant DE genes, printing message summarizing comparison number significant genes inform = TRUE (default). default filters applied data : padj < 0.05 abs(log2FoldChange) > log2(1.5).

title: tRavis
text: Compare two lists find common/unique elements, optional names argument apply results.

title: tRavis
text: Create named list files, easily piped purrr::map(~read.csv(.x)) generate named list data frames. Supports recursive searching, custom string/pattern removal, date removal assuming format like YYYYMMDD (can’t contain punctuation/symbols).
code: tr_get_files(   directory = system.file("extdata", package = "tRavis"),   pattern = "test",   date = TRUE,   remove_string = "test_" ) #> $file1 #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/tRavis/extdata/test_file1_20191231.csv" #>  #> $file2 #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/tRavis/extdata/test_file2_20200101.csv"

title: tRavis
text: Generate RNA-Seq QC plots MultiQC outputs. Currently supports summary plots FastQC, STAR, HTSeq. Plots created plotly, meaning can embedded RMarkdown documents retain interactivity.
code: tr_qc_plots(directory = "multiqc_data")

title: tRavis
text: Sort column alphanumeric strings (non-binary) numerical order given input data frame desired column. can use column name index, compatible pipes.
code: my_dataframe <- data.frame(   c1 = c("a1", "a11", "a5"),   c2 = c(2, 3, 2) )  tr_sort_alphanum(input_df = my_dataframe, sort_col = "c1") #>    c1 c2 #> 1  a1  2 #> 3  a5  2 #> 2 a11  3

title: tRavis
text: Simple wrapper around Fisher’s test gene enrichment, constructs matrix returns p value.
code: all_genes <- paste0("gene", sample(1:10000, 5000)) de_genes <- sample(all_genes, 1500) gene_set <- sample(all_genes, 100)  tr_test_enrichment(   query_genes = de_genes,    enrichment_set = gene_set,    total_genes = 5000 ) #> [1] 0.4506109

title: tRavis
text: Clean themes ggplot2 improve default increasing font size, changing background white, adding border. default, uses minimal grid, can easily remove grid entirely.
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(as.factor(cyl), mpg)) + geom_boxplot() + tr_theme() ggplot(mtcars, aes(as.factor(cyl), mpg)) + geom_boxplot() + tr_theme(grid = FALSE)

title: tRavis
text: Combines items “greater” “less” list output gage single tidy data frame (tibble), provides option filter results based q value.
code: gage_untidy <-    readRDS(system.file("extdata", "ex_gage_results.rds", package = "tRavis"))  lapply(gage_untidy, function(x) head(x, 3)) #> $greater #>                                   p.geomean stat.mean      p.val     q.val #> pae00470 D-Amino acid metabolism 0.06296276 1.6062714 0.06296276 0.9236319 #> pae01232 Nucleotide metabolism   0.11147089 1.2445332 0.11147089 0.9236319 #> pae00640 Propanoate metabolism   0.16732201 0.9936297 0.16732201 0.9236319 #>                                  set.size       exp1 #> pae00470 D-Amino acid metabolism       10 0.06296276 #> pae01232 Nucleotide metabolism         16 0.11147089 #> pae00640 Propanoate metabolism         11 0.16732201 #>  #> $less #>                                                    p.geomean stat.mean #> pae00650 Butanoate metabolism                     0.07636814 -1.484922 #> pae01230 Biosynthesis of amino acids              0.07731172 -1.435757 #> pae00260 Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism 0.08765647 -1.388323 #>                                                        p.val    q.val set.size #> pae00650 Butanoate metabolism                     0.07636814 0.680354       13 #> pae01230 Biosynthesis of amino acids              0.07731172 0.680354       45 #> pae00260 Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism 0.08765647 0.680354       16 #>                                                         exp1 #> pae00650 Butanoate metabolism                     0.07636814 #> pae01230 Biosynthesis of amino acids              0.07731172 #> pae00260 Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism 0.08765647 #>  #> $stats #>                                  stat.mean      exp1 #> pae00470 D-Amino acid metabolism 1.6062714 1.6062714 #> pae01232 Nucleotide metabolism   1.2445332 1.2445332 #> pae00640 Propanoate metabolism   0.9936297 0.9936297  tr_tidy_gage(gage_untidy, qval = 1) #> # A tibble: 70 × 7 #>    pathway                      p_geomean stat_mean  p_val q_val set_size   exp1 #>    <chr>                            <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 pae00470 D-Amino acid metab…    0.0630     1.61  0.0630 0.924       10 0.0630 #>  2 pae01232 Nucleotide metabol…    0.111      1.24  0.111  0.924       16 0.111  #>  3 pae00640 Propanoate metabol…    0.167      0.994 0.167  0.924       11 0.167  #>  4 pae00330 Arginine and proli…    0.179      0.937 0.179  0.924       14 0.179  #>  5 pae03010 Ribosome               0.197      0.862 0.197  0.924       19 0.197  #>  6 pae01210 2-Oxocarboxylic ac…    0.250      0.684 0.250  0.924       12 0.250  #>  7 pae02040 Flagellar assembly     0.267      0.635 0.267  0.924       11 0.267  #>  8 pae00620 Pyruvate metabolism    0.302      0.526 0.302  0.924       13 0.302  #>  9 pae02024 Quorum sensing         0.327      0.452 0.327  0.924       29 0.327  #> 10 pae00405 Phenazine biosynth…    0.367      0.345 0.367  0.924       10 0.367  #> # ℹ 60 more rows

title: tRavis
text: Simple function truncate long strings without breaking middle word. Useful trimming long axis labels plot. ’s also designed use inside mutate call:
code: tr_trunc_neatly(   x = "This is a long string that we want to break neatly",   l = 40 ) #> [1] "This is a long string that we want to..." ex_trunc_df <- dplyr::tibble(   col1 = c(1, 2, 3),   col2 = c(     "This is a pretty long string",     "This string is actually a bit longer",     "Here is the longest string of them all, just!"   ) )  dplyr::mutate(   ex_trunc_df,   col3 = purrr::map_chr(col2, ~tr_trunc_neatly(.x, l = 20)) ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>    col1 col2                                          col3                   #>   <dbl> <chr>                                         <chr>                  #> 1     1 This is a pretty long string                  This is a pretty...    #> 2     2 This string is actually a bit longer          This string is...      #> 3     3 Here is the longest string of them all, just! Here is the longest...

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
text: Given input CSV TSV annotation file https://pseudomonas.com, separates cleans data, returning tidy tibble following columns: "locus_tag", "gene_name", "product_name". Setting extra_cols argument TRUE add columns "start", "end", "strand". Enabling fill_names populate missing gene names corresponding locus tag.

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
code: tr_anno_cleaner(input_file, extra_cols = FALSE, fill_names = FALSE)

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
text: input_file Path input TSV CSV file. extra_cols Logical determine start, end, strand columns included. Defaults FALSE. fill_names Logical determine blank/NA genes names filled corresponding locus tag. Defaults FALSE.

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
text: data frame (tibble) cleaned input file

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
text: Download annotation files https://pseudomonas.com

title: Clean annotations from pseudomonas.com — tr_anno_cleaner
code: tr_anno_cleaner(   input_file = paste0(   "https://pseudomonas.com/downloads/pseudomonas/pgd_r_22_1/",   "Pseudomonas_aeruginosa_PAO1_107/Pseudomonas_aeruginosa_PAO1_107.csv.gz"   ) ) #> # A tibble: 5,713 × 3 #>    locus_tag gene_name product_name                                   #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                                          #>  1 PA0001    dnaA      chromosomal replication initiator protein DnaA #>  2 PA0002    dnaN      DNA polymerase III, beta chain                 #>  3 PA0003    recF      RecF protein                                   #>  4 PA0004    gyrB      DNA gyrase subunit B                           #>  5 PA0005    lptA      lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase, LptA    #>  6 PA0006    NA        conserved hypothetical protein                 #>  7 PA0007    NA        hypothetical protein                           #>  8 PA0008    glyS      glycyl-tRNA synthetase beta chain              #>  9 PA0009    glyQ      glycyl-tRNA synthetase alpha chain             #> 10 PA0010    tag       DNA-3-methyladenine glycosidase I              #> # ℹ 5,703 more rows

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
text: Helper function filter sort results DESeq2, aid identifying differentially expressed genes.

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
code: tr_clean_deseq2_result(   deseq2_result,   p_adjusted = 0.05,   fold_change = 1.5,   inform = TRUE )

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
text: deseq2_result Results object DE genes, class DESeqResults p_adjusted Threshold adjusted p-value, defaults 0.05 fold_change Threshold fold change, defaults 1.5 inform message printed DE comparison number DE genes found? Defaults TRUE.

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
text: data frame (tibble) filtered DE genes; see ?DESeq2::results details output.

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
text: https://bioconductor.org/packages/DESeq2/

title: Tidy results from DESeq2 — tr_clean_deseq2_result
code: ex_deseq_result <-   readRDS(system.file("extdata", "ex_deseq_results.rds", package = "tRavis")) #> Loading required package: DESeq2 #> Loading required package: S4Vectors #> Loading required package: stats4 #> Loading required package: BiocGenerics #>  #> Attaching package: ‘BiocGenerics’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     IQR, mad, sd, var, xtabs #> The title: Easily compare two lists — tr_compare_lists
text: Performs intersect(x, y), setdiff(x, y), setdiff(y, x). Returns elements list names "common", "unique_x", "unique_y".

title: Easily compare two lists — tr_compare_lists
code: tr_compare_lists(x, y, names = NULL)

title: Easily compare two lists — tr_compare_lists
text: x First vector compare. y Second vector compare. names Optional character vector, containing names x y apply output.

title: Easily compare two lists — tr_compare_lists
text: named list common unique elements x y.

what: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
title: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
text: Function creates named list files specified directory. list names trimmed versions file names, contents list file names . way, can easily piped purrr::map(~read.csv(.)) create named list data frames.

title: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
code: tr_get_files(   directory,   pattern = "",   recur = FALSE,   date = FALSE,   remove_string = NULL )

title: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
text: directory Directory containing files interest pattern Optional, case-sensitive pattern use file searching. pattern supplied, files specified directory matched. recur Whether file listing done recursively. Defaults FALSE. date file names contain date removed? Must formatted akin "YYYYMMDD", .e. numeric spaces, dashes, etc. Defaults FALSE. remove_string Optional string can removed file names creating names output list

title: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
text: Named list files

title: Create a named list of files — tr_get_files
code: tr_get_files(   directory = system.file("extdata", package = "tRavis"),   pattern = "test",   remove_string = "test_",   date = TRUE ) #> $file1 #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/tRavis/extdata/test_file1_20191231.csv" #>  #> $file2 #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/tRavis/extdata/test_file2_20200101.csv" #>

what: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
title: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
text: Creates three plotly figures MultiQC results, returns data along plot objects.

title: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
code: tr_qc_plots(directory)

title: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
text: directory Folder containing data files generated MultiQC, e.g. "multiqc/multiqc_data/"

title: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
text: List plotly objects, underlying data

title: Create plotly figures from MultiQC — tr_qc_plots
code: if (FALSE) tr_qc_plots("multiqc_data")

title: Properly sort alphanumeric strings — tr_sort_alphanum
text: Function sort column alphanumeric strings (e.g. c("a1", "a11", "a2")) numeric order (e.g. c("a1", "a2", "a11")). works pipes, can provide column name index argument sort_col.

title: Properly sort alphanumeric strings — tr_sort_alphanum
code: tr_sort_alphanum(input_df, sort_col)

title: Properly sort alphanumeric strings — tr_sort_alphanum
text: input_df Input data frame tibble sort_col Column used sorting. Can index, name quotes.

title: Properly sort alphanumeric strings — tr_sort_alphanum
text: Sorted data frame

title: Properly sort alphanumeric strings — tr_sort_alphanum
code: tr_sort_alphanum(   input_df = data.frame(colA = c(2, 1, 3), colB = c("m2", "m1", "m3")),   sort_col = "colB" ) #>   colA colB #> 2    1   m1 #> 1    2   m2 #> 3    3   m3

what: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
text: Performs Fisher's Exact test determine enrichment set genes interest compared list experimentally derived genes. Uses alternative = "greater" call fisher.test().

title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
code: tr_test_enrichment(query_genes, enrichment_set, total_genes)

title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
text: query_genes List experimentally otherwise derived genes, one wishes test enrichment enrichment_set Set genes interest, virulence genes total_genes Total number genes organism/species

title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
text: Numeric: raw p-value fisher.test()

title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
text: ?stats::fisher.test

title: Perform a basic enrichment test — tr_test_enrichment
code: all_genes <- paste0("gene", sample(1:10000, 5000)) de_genes <- sample(all_genes, 1500) ex_set <- sample(all_genes, 100)  tr_test_enrichment(   de_genes,   ex_set,   total_genes = 5000 ) #> [1] 0.1137562

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
text: Custom theme can applied ggplot2 plots. Increases base font size, sets white background, grey grid, black border.

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
code: tr_theme(base_size = 18, base_family = "", grid = TRUE)

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
text: base_size Base font size applied text plot base_family Base font type applies text plot grid Determines grid lines drawn. Defaults TRUEfor "major" grid lines drawn.

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
text: ggplot2 theme

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
text: None.

title: Customized ggplot2 theme — tr_theme
code: if (FALSE)   ggplot(mtcars, aes(cyl, mpg)) + geom_point() + tr_theme()

what: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
title: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
text: function simply convert output Gage enrichment easier--use tibble format. time can also filter result based q value, default 0.1.

title: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
code: tr_tidy_gage(gage_result, qval = 0.1)

title: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
text: gage_result list output call gage::gage qval Cutoff q value, defaults 0.1

title: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
text: data frame (tibble)

title: Coerce Gage output to a tidy data frame — tr_tidy_gage
code: ex_gage_results <-   readRDS(system.file("extdata", "ex_gage_results.rds", package = "tRavis"))  tr_tidy_gage(ex_gage_results, qval = 1) #> # A tibble: 70 × 7 #>    pathway                      p_geomean stat_mean  p_val q_val set_size   exp1 #>    <chr>                            <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 pae00470 D-Amino acid metab…    0.0630     1.61  0.0630 0.924       10 0.0630 #>  2 pae01232 Nucleotide metabol…    0.111      1.24  0.111  0.924       16 0.111  #>  3 pae00640 Propanoate metabol…    0.167      0.994 0.167  0.924       11 0.167  #>  4 pae00330 Arginine and proli…    0.179      0.937 0.179  0.924       14 0.179  #>  5 pae03010 Ribosome               0.197      0.862 0.197  0.924       19 0.197  #>  6 pae01210 2-Oxocarboxylic ac…    0.250      0.684 0.250  0.924       12 0.250  #>  7 pae02040 Flagellar assembly     0.267      0.635 0.267  0.924       11 0.267  #>  8 pae00620 Pyruvate metabolism    0.302      0.526 0.302  0.924       13 0.302  #>  9 pae02024 Quorum sensing         0.327      0.452 0.327  0.924       29 0.327  #> 10 pae00405 Phenazine biosynth…    0.367      0.345 0.367  0.924       10 0.367  #> # ℹ 60 more rows

title: Cleanly trim long strings — tr_trunc_neatly
text: Trims input string desired length, appending ellipsis end, without splitting middle word.

title: Cleanly trim long strings — tr_trunc_neatly
code: tr_trunc_neatly(x, l = 60)

title: Cleanly trim long strings — tr_trunc_neatly
text: x Input string trim desired length, appending ellipsis end, without splitting words l Desired length trim strings

title: Cleanly trim long strings — tr_trunc_neatly
text: Character string

title: Cleanly trim long strings — tr_trunc_neatly
code: tr_trunc_neatly("This is a test string", l = 17) #> [1] "This is a test..."
